DPPH scavenging assay was useful to evaluate the antioxidant content of crude fraction and their comparison with reference standard samples, being based on the hydrogen atom transfer reduction of the persistent DPPH radical [ 21, 22, 23]. The samples of extracts from sunflower receptacles with different concentrations (The final concentration were 625, 312.5, 156.25, 78.13, 39.06, 19.53, 9.77, 4.88, 2.44, 1.22, 0.61, 0.31 ug/mL, 0.5 mL each) and 0.08 mmol/L freshly prepared DPPH (3 mL each) were mixed in a test tube for 0.5 h incubation at room temperature in the dark. Then, absorbance at 517 nm was recorded. All measurements were made in triplicate ( n = 3). Using Equation (1):
